Description.val:
FY 2021 WPN provides continuation of Surface Ship Torpedo Defense (SSTD) which provides a layered defense capability to protect surface ships. The WPN appropriation is comprised of SSTD which includes Acoustic Device Countermeasures (ADCs) and Countermeasure Anti-Torpedo (CAT). The CAT provides canisterized Anti-Torpedo (ATT). The SSTD WPN account currently procures surface ship ADCs. The ADC is a 3-inch expendable torpedo countermeasure (CM) that provides an over-the-side soft-kill defense against threat torpedoes. A new contract award in FY 2021 for ADC contract will require start-up funding for Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) labor and material to address obsolescence and vendor qualifications. WPN funding will continue to provide new devices to meet fleet inventory requirements as identified in Naval Munitions Requirements Process (NMRP) necessary to equip identified surface ships and to replace expiring devices.  WPN funding will also continue procurement and installation of ready service and deep storage lockers to provide adequate storage for ADCs on surface ships with countermeasure allowance.  Additionally, the funding will also provide for the development of lockers for the CG and CVN classes of ships. 

TD010 - ADC HARDWARE: Procures surface ship ADCs.  Quantity requirements determined by NMRP and shelf life of older units (reaching end of life).  These requirements vary by ship type, location and operational posture. 

TD020 - ADC READY STOWAGE LOCKER: Procure and install ready service and deep storage lockers to hold ADCs on surface ships.

TD830 - PRODUCTION ENGINEERING - In House: Funding provides specification preparation and validation, government prepared production acceptance procedures, production planning, Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) planning, coordination of government furnished information (GFI) and government furnished equipment (GFE), contract deliverable monitoring and prime contractor monitoring of cost/schedule performance.  Also provides in-service engineering agent (ISEA) and technical direction agent (TDA) support for ADCs on surface ships. 

TD900 - CONSULTING SERVICES: Funding under this cost code provides fair share of contractor support to the program office, including program, financial, acquisition, contract, administration and engineering management support.

TD905 - PRODUCTION ENGINEERING CONTRACTOR: Funding under this cost code provides for production engineering tasks performed by the hardware contractor.

Justification.val: The FY 2021 funding procures surface ship Acoustic Device Countermeasures (ADC), ready stowage lockers, production engineering and contractor support services.

Name.@footnote: The increase in APUC by 6.5% is the historical amount that has been added to the unit price to cover the contract service fees, engineering, and logistic efforts.  ECP labor and materials cost are also embedded in the unit price.
In FY 2021, follow on contract is awarded and startup for NRE labor and materials are funded.
